resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/104367</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>104367</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770211607</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Polar Energy</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Polare Energie</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Énergie Polaire</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Energia Polar</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Energia Polare</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Πολική ενέργεια</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Energía Polar</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">The poles are fascinating, partly because they are such difficult places to visit, work and live. They still guard many mysteries that we'd like to unravel, including the survival of polar animals, the history of ancient peoples, and the understanding of Earth's climate.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Die Pfosten sind, teils faszinierend, weil sie 
solche schwierige zu besuchende sind, zu arbeiten und zu leben 
Plätze. Sie schützen noch viele Geheimnisse, die wir möchten,
daß, einschließlich das Überleben der polaren Tiere, die Geschichte
der alten Völker entwirren, und das Verständnis des Klimas der
Masse.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les poteaux sont fascinants, en partie parce 
qu'ils sont de tels endroits difficiles à visiter, travailler et 
vivre. Ils gardent toujours beaucoup de mystères qui nous 
voudrions que se démêlent, y compris la survie des animaux 
polaires, l'histoire des peuples antiques, et l'arrangement du climat 
de la terre.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os pólos são fascinantes, em parte porque são 
tais lugares difíceis a visitar, trabalhar e viver. Guardam 
ainda muitos mistérios que nós gostaríamos de unravel, including a 
sobrevivência de animais polares, o history de povos antigos, e a 
compreensão do clima da terra.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">I pali sono affascinanti, parzialmente perché 
sono tali posti difficili da visitare, funzionare e vivere. 
Ancora custodiscono molti misteri che vorremmo unravel, compreso
la sopravvivenza degli animali polari, la storia della gente antica e 
la comprensione del clima della terra.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι πόλοι είναι συναρπαστικοί, εν μέρει επειδή είναι 
τέτοιες δύσκολες θέσεις για να επισκεφτούν, να εργαστούν και να 
ζήσουν. Φρουρούν ακόμα πολλά μυστήρια που θα επιθυμούσαμε 
να διευκρινίσουμε, συμπεριλαμβανομένης της επιβίωσης των πολικών 
ζώων, την ιστορία των αρχαίων λαών, και την κατανόηση του γήινου
κλίματος.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los postes son fascinadores, en parte porque son 
tales lugares difíciles a visitar, a trabajar y a vivir. 
Todavía guardan muchos misterios que quisiéramos que 
desenredaran, incluyendo la supervivencia de animales polares, la 
historia de la gente antigua, y la comprensión del clima de la 
tierra.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:DAVID TENENBAUM
FN:DAVID TENENBAUM
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770211607</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>104367</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/polar-energy</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
